description.narrative: The project will have a 3-pronged approach aimed at enhancing the rights of persons with disabilities in Cambodia.

activity-description.narrative: The project will cover whole country (national level) and with some specific activities in six target provinces which are Kampot , Svay Rieng, Kampong Cham, Takeo, Battambang and Kampong Speu . In addition, activities related to improving access to employment and skills enhancement will be done in

sector.narrative: Eradicate poverty in all its forms and dimensions

condition.narrative: UNDP as the Implementing Partner will comply with the policies, procedures and practices of the United Nations Security Management System (UNSMS.)

description.narrative: - Final situational analysis report - disability training conducted virtually - full proposal developed

comment.narrative: - Situational analysis was conducted in early 2021 - Covid -19 recovery plan for disability
1. Final report on situational analysis on disability 2. 10 days disability training 3. final proposal to be submitted to UNPRPD

1. The final report of the situation analysis on disability - formally name National Situational Analysis of the Rights of Persons with Disabilities was finalized. The analysis aimed to provide a high level analysis of the legislative and policy context regarding disability, budget allocation, use of data and mainstreaming of disability across critical sectoral areas in Cambodia; to engage relevant stakeholders, including OPDs, to gain a high level understanding of critical issues, policies, gaps and opportunities and build a base of mutual understanding to bring into future co-design of programs for persons with disabilities, or programs that are inclusive of persons with disabilities; to understand the impact of the COVID-19 pandemic on the rights and wellbeing of persons with disabilities in Cambodia and their access to services and supports; to provide an evidence-based disability rights perspective to support COVID-19 recovery planning, both during and after the pandemic; and introduction to disability in country. Key findings found that the rapid needs assessments and surveys conducted by NGOs to date have involved relatively small numbers of persons with disabilities in a limited number of provinces and/or districts. It is also important to acknowledge that the pandemic is not impacting on all persons with disabilities in the same way. Differences such as age, gender, type of disability, support needs, and location must be taken into account in COVID-19 recovery responses. Cambodia lacks a comprehensive situation analysis and needs assessment that identifies what services are currently available and where to identify gaps, and to assess the different needs of women, girls, boys and men with all types of disabilities, older persons with disabilities, and persons with high support needs, including those in rural areas. A comprehensive analysis and assessment would not only provide a strong foundation for advocacy, it would provide a baseline for measuring progress in achieving the objectives of the NDSP2 and the CSDG, and in implementing the CRPD.
2.10 days UNPRPD Induction Workshop was conducted. It aimed to provide 1) an introduction to UNPRPD’s Strategic Operational Framework, 2) basic knowledge of the CRPD and disability inclusive SDGs, and 3) an introduction to the preconditions for disability inclusion so that UNCTs and partners are able to conduct the Situational Analysis and develop joint country-level programmes in line with UNPRPD’s strategy and funding call requirements. Overall, participants expressed their satisfaction with the training and emphasized that it was a well-prepared training on disabilities via digital that they have never attended before, particularly the inclusion of the persons with visual, hearing impairments, women with disabilities, and sign language interpreters. 69%, 84%, and 75% of the participants were satisfied with the training materials, training organization, and accessibility respectively. The participants suggested integrating this training into the national training of the country, and produce the training materials in braille.
3. Final proposal was finalized and submitted to UNPRPD Secretariat for approval. The implementation phase will be started in January 2022. The UN joint programme will be implemented by UNDP, UNESCO and UNOHCHR. The programme will cover from January 2022- December 2023.
